poem:
### A Call to the Deep  
  
In the continent's shadow, a reef blooms,  
an Eden adrift on turquoise breath—  
rare creatures weave through liquid rooms,  
silent protestors to human death.  
We promised Eden a lasting reprieve,  
yet words drift thin as morning mist—  
as fragile as coral, the dreams we leave,  
lost to nature's forgotten list.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Labor hasn’t delivered on more effective nature laws. It’s not just embarrassing, it’s calamitous | Tim Winton Late last spring, I was part of an expedition to Scott Reef, a magnificent coral atoll nearly 300 kilometres off the Kimberley coast. And while it was a privilege to be in such a remote and wonderful place, watching rare and endemic sea life drifting past, the moment I tipped from the boat in my mask and fins,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
